page.title: 04RECREATION
page.content:
THE{POLO GROUND}IS SITUATED NEAR TO THE VILLAGE OF{OSMASTON}IN SQUARE 04200343.IT WAS FIRST USED IN ABOUT 1930,THE DATE BEING SOMEWHAT UNCERTAIN .POLO WAS PLAYED THERE UP TO THE WAR IN 1939 BY A TEAM LED BY SIR IAN WALKER OKEOVER OF OSMASTON HALL.
IN 1950 SIR IAN,WHILST STILL RETAINING OWNERSHIP OF THE LAND,OPENED IT AS A SPORTS FIELD FOR THE PEOPLE OF OSMASTON.IT IS NOW USED BY LOCAL FOOTBALL AND CRICKET TEAMS.ABOUT 20 TIMES A YEAR CARAVAN CLUBS MEET THERE FOR WEEKEND CAMPS.THE WYASTON AND ASHBOURNE SHOWS ARE HELD THERE ANNUALLY.
WHEN NOT IN USE FOR A PARTICULAR OCCASION,THE FIELD IS AVAILABLE FOR USE BY THE VILLAGERS.THE ORIGINAL NAME HAS BEEN RETAINED.
